intro: Gymnocarpium oyamense var. gracilipes, commonly known as the slender-stemmed false gallnut, is a rare flowering plant native to Japan. It belongs to the family Berberidaceae and is characterized by its herbaceous growth habit and distinctive, clustered inflorescences. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are followed by rounded, berry-like fruits. Its leaves are alternate, simple, and have a rough texture with prominent veins. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a delicate and ecologically significant species.
